description:
Schex avoids overplotting for large single cell RNA-sequencing datasets.

Hexbin plots for single cell omics data.

Builds hexbin plots for variables and dimension reduction stored in single cell omics data such as SingleCellExperiment and SeuratObject. The ideas used in this package are based on the excellent work of Dan Carr, Nicholas Lewin-Koh, Martin Maechler and Thomas Lumley.

The goal of schex is to provide easy plotting of hexagon cell representations of single cell data stored in SingleCellExperiment or Seurat objects.

You can install schex using the Bioconductor project:.

# install.packages("BiocManager").

DimensionReduction, Sequencing, SingleCell, Software, Visualization.

metadata.abstract: © 2019 The Author(s). Published by Oxford University Press.Summary: Due to the scale and sparsity of single-cell RNA-sequencing data, traditional plots can obscure vital information. Our R package schex overcomes this by implementing hexagonal binning, which has the additional advantages of improving speed and reducing storage for resulting plots.
